column4: I am not able to run the sudo apt-get update command in the terminal. It says cannot connect to the proxy
are you using a connection that needs a proxy?
ellie: yes it is connected directly to the net
i used to to use one before
now you don't have a proxy? try export http_proxy"". i think it should work after this
dnivra_I know that , the thing is i dont use proxy now , i am directly connected to the net
I had added it in /etc/bash.bash.rc
just run that command I gave you and it should work
you'll need to keep doing that everytime you close the terminal and open it since it's in the bash.bashrc file
I hashed it in /etc/bash.bashrc
i suggest you uncomment/remove those entries you added from the file and then restart terminal as a permanent solution. for temporary just use the command I gave you:).
comment*. good now restart terminal
Well i did try that it is still not working
i had done that before
didn't get you; done what before?
ok, removed the lines and restarted the terminal again
any luck?
no
do echo $http_proxy. is it blank or has some value?
no value
i usually just set that value when necessary and then it works. it gets unset when I quit
try running source /etc/bash.bashrc. doesn't work i've no idea; sorry. perhaps someone else would help out here.
k
let me know if it works ok. "source /etc/bash.bashrc" just a guess that's all:).
